content:
Based on the conversation with @Douglas McNeil , I am now learning how to generate SAT dimacs code and then use it in Kissat.

Has anyone tried that? esp with SAGE? (I'm using sage.sat.solvers.dimacs)
Lean already ships CaDiCal and has built in support for SAT related things in the Std.Sat module that I would recommend to use if applicable.

Henrik Böving schrieb:

Lean already ships CaDiCal and has built in support for SAT related things in the Std.Sat module that I would recommend to use if applicable.

Perfect! I'll use that then! Appreciate the help
CaDiCal and Kissat are closely related. Both of them are quite close to top of the line solvers right now though Kissat does win in SATCOMP currently. (Both are made by the same team)
Both AIG and CNF seem great. So, an AIG-based SAT solver like ABC or CNF solver like Kissat wouldn't be needed anymore?

The point of the AIG data structure is to have the ability to easily construct circuits with sub circuit sharing which gives us an exponential improvement of circuit size in the best case. The AIG can be translated to a CNF through a tseitin transformation and then given to a sat solver. Pretty much all state of the art SAT solvers at the moment work on CNF as input.
Michael Bucko has marked this topic as resolved.
